content.text:
[cron:8b380d56-7314-4ba9-b4c4-ea11d3e5ca6f PR Review Patrol (High Frequency)] PR patrol for bills-bot.

Repo: /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/

⚠️ CRITICAL RULE: Only check PRs authored by Bill (BillChirico) or by Pip Build / sub-agents. Do NOT check, fix, or address PRs from anyone else (other contributors, bots like coderabbitai, dependabot[bot], renovate[bot]) unless Bill has explicitly told you to.

Do this each run:
1) List open PRs in BillChirico/bills-bot.
2) Filter to ONLY Bill's PRs and Pip Build's PRs. Skip everything else.
3) For eligible PRs, count unresolved review threads.
4) If no unresolved threads on eligible PRs: respond exactly `NO_REPLY`.
5) If unresolved threads exist:
   - Spawn ONE sub-agent PER PR (parallel), never batch PRs together.
   - Use agentId `build`, model `anthropic/claude-opus-4-6`, thinking `high`.
   - Include full unresolved thread details (thread id, file path, line, issue summary).
   - Instruct spawned agents to read and follow CODING.md, fix all review comments (including nitpicks unless nonsensical/breaking/redundant), run tests/coverage, resolve threads.
   - Instruct spawned agents NOT to post PR summary comments unless Bill explicitly asks.
   - Have spawned agents report completion summary back to parent agent.
   - After spawning, send Bill a concise Discord DM status update:
     - channel: discord
     - target: user:191633014441115648
     - accountId: pip-build
     - include PR numbers and unresolved thread counts.
6) If any spawned run fails/stalls, note it in DM and respawn once.

Keep updates concise and action-oriented.
Current time: Tuesday, February 17th, 2026 — 3:37 AM (America/New_York)

content.thinking:
The user is asking me to run the PR Review Patrol cron job for bills-bot. Let me follow the steps:

1. List open PRs in BillChirico/bills-bot
2. Filter to ONLY Bill's PRs and Pip Build's PRs
3. Count unresolved review threads
4. If none, respond NO_REPLY
5. If there are unresolved threads, spawn sub-agents and notify Bill

Let me start by checking the open PRs.

arguments.command: cd /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot && gh pr list --state open --json number,title,author,headRefName --jq '.[] | select(.author.login == "BillChirico" or .author.login == "pip-build" or .author.login == "bill-chirico[bot]")'

content.text: {"author":{"id":"MDQ6VXNlcjEzOTUxMzE2","is_bot":false,"login":"BillChirico","name":"Bill Chirico"},"headRefName":"feat/rest-api","number":70,"title":"feat: REST API layer for web dashboard"}

details.aggregated: {"author":{"id":"MDQ6VXNlcjEzOTUxMzE2","is_bot":false,"login":"BillChirico","name":"Bill Chirico"},"headRefName":"feat/rest-api","number":70,"title":"feat: REST API layer for web dashboard"}

content.thinking: Good, only one open PR from Bill: PR #70 (feat/rest-api). Now I need to count unresolved review threads with pagination (CRITICAL rule in MEMORY.md).

arguments.command:
cd /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot && PR_NUM=70 && CURSOR="" && TOTAL_UNRESOLVED=0 && while true; do
  if [ -z "$CURSOR" ]; then
    RESULT=$(gh api graphql -f query="{repository(owner:\"BillChirico\",name:\"bills-bot\"){pullRequest(number:$PR_NUM){reviewThreads(first:100){pageInfo{hasNextPage endCursor} nodes{isResolved}}}}}")
  else
    RESULT=$(gh api graphql -f query="{repository(owner:\"BillChirico\",name:\"bills-bot\"){pullRequest(number:$PR_NUM){reviewThreads(first:100,after:\"$CURSOR\"){pageInfo{hasNextPage endCursor} nodes{isResolved}}}}}")
  fi
  PAGE_UNRESOLVED=$(echo "$RESULT" | python3 -c "import sys,json; d=json.load(sys.stdin); print(len([n for n in d['data']['repository']['pullRequest']['reviewThreads']['nodes'] if not n['isResolved']]))")
  TOTAL_UNRESOLVED=$((TOTAL_UNRESOLVED + PAGE_UNRESOLVED))
  HAS_NEXT=$(echo "$RESULT" | python3 -c "import sys,json; d=json.load(sys.stdin); print(d['data']['repository']['pullRequest']['reviewThreads']['pageInfo']['hasNextPage'])")
  if [ "$HAS_NEXT" = "True" ]; then
    CURSOR=$(echo "$RESULT" | python3 -c "import sys,json; d=json.load(sys.stdin); print(d['data']['repository']['pullRequest']['reviewThreads']['pageInfo']['endCursor'])")
  else
    break
  fi
done && echo "PR #$PR_NUM: $TOTAL_UNRESOLVED unresolved threads"

content.thinking: PR #70 has 0 unresolved threads. According to the instructions, if no unresolved threads on eligible PRs, I should respond exactly `NO_REPLY`.
